text: the world is desperate for a treatment
of cure for Kovach 19th and while
scientists seek new drugs and approaches
many look to remedies they believe have
kept them healthy in the past to ward
off this new threat herbal and homemade
remedies we've seen a wide range of
natural or herbal remedies shed online
across many parts of the world some
suggest eating garlic or ginger gargling
with salt water and vinegar or drinking
herbal teas others encourage drinking
lemon juice or inhaling steam to be
clear there's absolutely no evidence any
of these have any effect on the virus so
why do they keep resurfacing for
hundreds perhaps even thousands of years
in the absence of modern medicine these
remedies have been used to treat the
symptoms of common ailments like the
common cold and flu it's true that a
diet including fresh fruits and
vegetables is generally good for you but
there's no evidence consuming herbal
remedies can fight off or boost your
natural immunity to cope it 19 cow
byproducts some suggested treatments
have their roots in religious ritual and
farming cow manure has been widely used
as a fertilizer in agriculture for
centuries now cow urine is being
promoted to fight the corona virus in
Kenya it's been recommended as an
alternative hand sanitizer to kill the
virus that won't work so stick to soap
and water in India where cows are
considered sacred
in Hinduism their urine and byproducts
have been used in ayurvedic traditional
medicine since ancient times religious
groups and some politicians their claim
that cow urine can protect you from the
corona virus despite it containing
potentially harmful bacteria cow urine
drinking parties were posted in at least
two
States and there were reports of a man
being hospitalized after taking part but
there's no current scientific evidence
that cow byproducts have any effect
against kovat 19 drinking cow urine or
using it to sanitize your hands is not
going to protect you the miracle cure
the desire for there to be a cure out
there right now to go with 19 is a
powerful one so it's perhaps not
surprising that something touted as a
miracle cure has gained widespread
attention online in many parts of the
world the miracle mineral solution or
MMS does not as its promoters claim have
any effect on the virus
in fact it contains a textile bleaching
agent chlorine dioxide which is
extremely harmful if consumed and could
land you in hospital it's been around
since 2010 as a fake cure for a wide
range of ailments both the US Food and
Drug Administration and the World Health
Organization have issued warnings
against its use so as tempting as it is
to believe these alternative medicines
work against the corona virus do not
fall for false hopes that could well be
harmful the search goes on across the
world for effective treatments and they
will come in time but for now the best
thing you can do is to maintain social
distancing and keep washing your hands
